intro: Fedia graciliflora subsp. diana, commonly known as the slender-flowered fedia, is a rare and delicate plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in cool, moist environments, often in mountainous or alpine habitats. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
